com.example.clock

Class timerActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • com.example.clock.timerActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public class timerActivity
extends android.app.Activity
    timerActivity is the activity that gives a interfaces for using the actualTimer class written by Sierra Seacat.

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        onCreate is called when the activity is first loaded. We initialize all variables and start the Handler.
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - Default parameter set by android
        Since:
        1.0

      • callHandler

        public void callHandler()
        Creates an instance of the Handler Class and updateTimer class. Queues calls to the run method from the updateTimer class every one second.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        updateTimer

      • removeHandler

        public void removeHandler()
        Destroys all calls to the run method in the Handler Queue. Resets the Handler class to point at null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        updateTimer

      • zoomText

        public void zoomText(android.view.View view)
        Uses setTextSize to change the font size of each element in the layout individually. if the zoomFlag is true, it is in the zoom state, false is non-zoomed state.
        Parameters:
        view -
